metadata.title: CVE-2020-26116 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
http.client in Python 3.x before 3.5.10, 3.6.x before 3.6.12, 3.7.x before3.7.9, and 3.8.x before 3.8.5 allows CRLF injection if the attackercontrols the HTTP request method, as demonstrated by inserting CR and LFcontrol characters in the first argument of HTTPConnection.request.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm8
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm8
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm8
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm8
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm8
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm8
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm8
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm8
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm1
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm1
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm1
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm1
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm1
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm1
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm1
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm1
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python3.4 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm8').
python3.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.4~14.04.1+esm1').
